definition: to abscond without leaving a trace (idiom)

sentences.english: Jim absconded abroad, then was caught aboard a ship.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆潜逃到国外，后来在船上被抓获。

sentences.english: Pan gets disobedient name, tonight namely abscond.
sentences.chinese: 拚得不孝名，今夜即潜逃。

sentences.english: The treasurer decamped with part of the company's payroll.
sentences.chinese: 司库携公司工资总额之部分潜逃了。

sentences.english: This also is not difficult to explain a lot of real estate Why can the boss absconded money.
sentences.chinese: 这也不难解释了很多房地产为什么老板潜逃钱。

sentences.english: The treasurer ran off with all the club's funds.
sentences.chinese: 司库携俱乐部的全部款子潜逃。

sentences.english: The company treasurer absconded with the funds.
He absconded with the company funds.
sentences.chinese: 他卷走公司的钱潜逃了。

sentences.english: The band of thieves decamped in the night.
The risk of maids absconding will definitely go up.
sentences.chinese: 雇主面对女佣潜逃的风险也相应增加。

sentences.english: The prison guards could not discover the location of the escape tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 监狱看守无法找到潜逃地道的所在地。

sentences.english: He absconded from a remand home.
sentences.chinese: 他从青少年拘留所潜逃了。

sentences.english: The treasurer has eloped with the company's funds.
sentences.chinese: 财务主管带着公司的钱潜逃了。

sentences.english: He was cold and hungry after a week on the run so he gave himself up to the police.
sentences.chinese: 他上路潜逃一个星期后饥寒交迫，只得向警方自首了。

sentences.english: After casting a stone at the police, they absconded with the money. (Ibid)
sentences.chinese: 他们向警察投掷石块，后携款潜逃。

definition: (of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
escaped criminal/fugitive from the law (criminal suspect on the run)
to be at large (of a criminal)
to bring to justice/to file away (a document)
to flee abroad/to run away/to desert/outflow
to fall into the net of justice (idiom); finally arrested
to commit a crime or offence
to send away under escort (criminals, goods etc)
It is hard to escape the dragnet of the law/the long arm of the law
